intro: Luzula spadicea var. divaricata, commonly known as the silver sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or streamside habitats. Its foliage is often covered in a silvery bloom, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family.
